Summary: "Implements a serializer that converts StarkNet field elements (felt) to and from their binary representation, enforcing range checks and supporting short‑string encoding, and integrates with the library’s serialization context."

Business intent: "Facilitate reliable (de)serialization of felt values when interacting with StarkNet contracts, ensuring data integrity and compatibility with the Cairo serialization framework."

Keywords list: ["felt", "field element", "serialization", "deserialization", "StarkNet", "Cairo", "range validation", "short string", "encode_shortstring", "FIELD_PRIME", "context-aware", "data serializer"].

Check format: Must start with {{ and end with }}? The example shows double braces but they are just placeholder. Actually they said "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}." That seems contradictory: JSON normally starts with { not {{. But example: {{"summary": "...", ...}}. They used double braces to indicate placeholder? The instruction: "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}. Example: {{\"summary\": \"...\", ...}}". So they want double braces. We'll follow that.

Thus output:

{{"summary": "...", "business_intent": "...", "keywords": [...]}}

Make sure proper escaping.
